Bradley, Todd wrote:

>  > I have yet to be on a project where /anyone/ /ever/ wanted to
>  > run "all the database tests". All the /slow/ tests, sure. All
>  > the tests that fail intermittently due to configuration
>  > problems, absolutely.
> 
> I just ran "all the database tests" this morning, and I
> didn't think anything was unusual about it at all.

Why do you need to run all the database tests, but not, say, all the 
slow tests? or all the tests? Did you really need to run all the 
database tests, or do they happen to be a convenient subset of the slow 
tests? What prompted you to partition the tests by "database", rather 
than "slow" or "needs configuration"?
